page.title: 20EMPLOYMENT IN SHALBOURNE
page.content:
Although a farming area, few people are now employed on the land. Many agricultural workers have had to find other occupations; some are now self employed using their skills in land- scape gardening, grass/hedge cutting etc. Others work for Local Authorities or in public utilities. Many women in the area do domestic work, there being more work available than those able or willing to do it. There are several small businesses or agencies run from homes. About half the working popula- tion are employed in adjoining towns. There is not a high percentage of unemployment in the area; most over 18 year olds leave the village for training and find work elsewhere.
